page.title: 07GEOLOGY OF THE AREA
page.content: {Reading beds:}which predominate in the central and northern area covering some 40% of the total study area. These were laid down some 55 million years ago in the so called Eocene period. They consist of sand and mottle red and white clay. Towards Dorchester the sand is fairly coarse and contains some flint gravel. {Alluvium:}in the Frome Valley which covers some 35% of the area in the southern and central parts. This was laid down in comparatively recent times. {Chalk:}covers some 15% of the area and is confined to the western end. This was laid down some 65 to 100 million years ago. {Gravels:}cover some 10% of the area in 4 main patches.These were laid down in Palealithic times.
